message: website: dapshare.com.  The website has a deliberate Australian flavour; intention is to market locally to Australian universities (the only site functionality relating to this is bank account details).
Appreciate any of your comments; thanks for taking a look.
A google search produces many sites trying to do the same thing.  How is dapShare any different? 100% free, integrated commenting, news feed, and customisable debt reminders.
Hmm...  I just use a Google speadsheet for this sort of thing.  It's pretty easy.  Not sure I see a need for something like this.

I've used a spreadsheet in the past.  What I found is that a lot of my housemates weren't tech savvy enough to use it.  This app also allows for easy discussion of each item, and automatically sends notifications and reminders.

@robertdapice Looks good. One piece of feedback might be to have more of a "taste"of the app on the front page. (more screenshots? a screecast?). A similar American company, WePay might be a place to look for inspiration. (I think they are a YCombinator company, grew out of a similar need to collect money from roommates, etc, and now have more general use-cases as well.)

@thesethings, thanks for the thoughtful feedback.  You're absolutely right about having 'more' on the homepage - I was thinking a scrolling series of screenshots each showing different features of the app.  A video would be great, but I think they can look v amateurish if not done really well.
There are bunch of great websites in the US in the personal finance space (Mint, for one).  It's a shame they never come to Oz.  Well, perhaps a shame, perhaps an opportunity... :)

@robertdapice To address you amateur-looking-video concerns, one cool thing about screencasts (or any other type of "in the box" video) is that at least at a compositional level, every shot is "perfect." With live action videos there is so much to go wrong (bad camera, bad sound, bad light, etc).
@robertdapice in any case, a slideshow of screenshots would be great.
@thesethings, Thanks very much for the tips.  Ill have a shot at building a slideshow or video over the next few days.
